description: Take n-th palindromic prime p, let P = all primes having same digits; a(n) = q-p where q is smallest prime in P >p if q exists; otherwise a(n) = p-r where r is largest prime in P
comments: The primes in P are required to have the same number of digits as p; thus internal 0's must remain internal 0's.
example: a(8)=180 because the distance from 131 to 311 is 180.
author: _Enoch Haga_, Mar 17 2000
